32 struct BoundingSphere
33 {
34 Vector3 centre;
35 real radius;
36
37 public:
41 BoundingSphere(const Vector3 &centre, real radius);
42
47 BoundingSphere(const BoundingSphere &one, const BoundingSphere &two);
48
53 bool overlaps(const BoundingSphere *other) const;
54
63 real getGrowth(const BoundingSphere &other) const;
64
70 real getSize() const
71 {
72 return ((real)1.333333) * R_PI * radius * radius * radius;
73 }
74 };

79 struct PotentialContact
80 {
84 RigidBody* body[2];
85 };

93 template<class BoundingVolumeClass>
94 class BVHNode
95 {
96 public:
100 BVHNode * children[2];
101
106 BoundingVolumeClass volume;
107
116 RigidBody * body;
117
118 // ... other BVHNode code as before ...
119
123 BVHNode * parent;
124
128 BVHNode(BVHNode *parent, const BoundingVolumeClass &volume,
129 RigidBody* body=NULL)
130 : parent(parent), volume(volume), body(body)
131 {
132 children[0] = children[1] = NULL;
133 }
134
138 bool isLeaf() const
139 {
140 return (body != NULL);
141 }
142
149 unsigned getPotentialContacts(PotentialContact* contacts,
150 unsigned limit) const;
151
157 void insert(RigidBody* body, const BoundingVolumeClass &volume);
158
169 ~BVHNode();
170
171 protected:
172
178 bool overlaps(const BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass> *other) const;
179
186 unsigned getPotentialContactsWith(
187 const BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass> *other,
188 PotentialContact* contacts,
189 unsigned limit) const;
190
195 void recalculateBoundingVolume(bool recurse = true);
196 };

198 // Note that, because we're dealing with a template here, we
199 // need to have the implementations accessible to anything that
200 // imports this header.
201
202 template<class BoundingVolumeClass>
203 bool BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass>::overlaps(
204 const BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass> * other
205 ) const
206 {
207 return volume->overlaps(other->volume);
208 }
209
210 template<class BoundingVolumeClass>
211 void BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass>::insert(
212 RigidBody* newBody, const BoundingVolumeClass &newVolume
213 )
214 {
215 // If we are a leaf, then the only option is to spawn two
216 // new children and place the new body in one.
217 if (isLeaf())
218 {
219 // Child one is a copy of us.
220 children[0] = new BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass>(
221 this, volume, body
222 );
223
224 // Child two holds the new body
225 children[1] = new BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass>(
226 this, newVolume, newBody
227 );
228
229 // And we now loose the body (we're no longer a leaf)
230 this->body = NULL;
231
232 // We need to recalculate our bounding volume
233 recalculateBoundingVolume();
234 }
235
236 // Otherwise we need to work out which child gets to keep
237 // the inserted body. We give it to whoever would grow the
238 // least to incorporate it.
239 else
240 {
241 if (children[0]->volume.getGrowth(newVolume) <
242 children[1]->volume.getGrowth(newVolume))
243 {
244 children[0]->insert(newBody, newVolume);
245 }
246 else
247 {
248 children[1]->insert(newBody, newVolume);
249 }
250 }
251 }
252
253 template<class BoundingVolumeClass>
254 BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass>::~BVHNode()
255 {
256 // If we don't have a parent, then we ignore the sibling
257 // processing
258 if (parent)
259 {
260 // Find our sibling
261 BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass> *sibling;
262 if (parent->children[0] == this) sibling = parent->children[1];
263 else sibling = parent->children[0];
264
265 // Write its data to our parent
266 parent->volume = sibling->volume;
267 parent->body = sibling->body;
268 parent->children[0] = sibling->children[0];
269 parent->children[1] = sibling->children[1];
270
271 // Delete the sibling (we blank its parent and
272 // children to avoid processing/deleting them)
273 sibling->parent = NULL;
274 sibling->body = NULL;
275 sibling->children[0] = NULL;
276 sibling->children[1] = NULL;
277 delete sibling;
278
279 // Recalculate the parent's bounding volume
280 parent->recalculateBoundingVolume();
281 }
282
283 // Delete our children (again we remove their
284 // parent data so we don't try to process their siblings
285 // as they are deleted).
286 if (children[0]) {
287 children[0]->parent = NULL;
288 delete children[0];
289 }
290 if (children[1]) {
291 children[1]->parent = NULL;
292 delete children[1];
293 }
294 }
295
296 template<class BoundingVolumeClass>
297 void BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass>::recalculateBoundingVolume(
298 bool recurse
299 )
300 {
301 if (isLeaf()) return;
302
303 // Use the bounding volume combining constructor.
304 volume = BoundingVolumeClass(
305 children[0]->volume,
306 children[1]->volume
307 );
308
309 // Recurse up the tree
310 if (parent) parent->recalculateBoundingVolume(true);
311 }
312
313 template<class BoundingVolumeClass>
314 unsigned BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass>::getPotentialContacts(
315 PotentialContact* contacts, unsigned limit
316 ) const
317 {
318 // Early out if we don't have the room for contacts, or
319 // if we're a leaf node.
320 if (isLeaf() || limit == 0) return 0;
321
322 // Get the potential contacts of one of our children with
323 // the other
324 return children[0]->getPotentialContactsWith(
325 children[1], contacts, limit
326 );
327 }
328
329 template<class BoundingVolumeClass>
330 unsigned BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass>::getPotentialContactsWith(
331 const BVHNode<BoundingVolumeClass> *other,
332 PotentialContact* contacts,
333 unsigned limit
334 ) const
335 {
336 // Early out if we don't overlap or if we have no room
337 // to report contacts
338 if (!overlaps(other) || limit == 0) return 0;
339
340 // If we're both at leaf nodes, then we have a potential contact
341 if (isLeaf() && other->isLeaf())
342 {
343 contacts->body[0] = body;
344 contacts->body[1] = other->body;
345 return 1;
346 }
347
348 // Determine which node to descend into. If either is
349 // a leaf, then we descend the other. If both are branches,
350 // then we use the one with the largest size.
351 if (other->isLeaf() ||
352 (!isLeaf() && volume->getSize() >= other->volume->getSize()))
353 {
354 // Recurse into ourself
355 unsigned count = children[0]->getPotentialContactsWith(
356 other, contacts, limit
357 );
358
359 // Check we have enough slots to do the other side too
360 if (limit > count) {
361 return count + children[1]->getPotentialContactsWith(
362 other, contacts+count, limit-count
363 );
364 } else {
365 return count;
366 }
367 }
368 else
369 {
370 // Recurse into the other node
371 unsigned count = getPotentialContactsWith(
372 other->children[0], contacts, limit
373 );
374
375 // Check we have enough slots to do the other side too
376 if (limit > count) {
377 return count + getPotentialContactsWith(
378 other->children[1], contacts+count, limit-count
379 );
380 } else {
381 return count;
382 }
383 }
384 }
385
